name: CreateBatchExportBackfill
description:
Create a new backfill for a batch export.

This tool is used to initiate a new backfill process for a specific BatchExport within a project, allowing for data replenishment or correction in Datadog.

parameters.name: batch_export_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the batch export to be backfilled. This ID determines which specific export the backfill will apply to.

parameters.name: project_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the project to access. Retrieve this via a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: backfill_request_body
parameters.description: JSON object containing details like data interval start/end, status, and timestamps for the backfill creation.

start_at.description: The start of the data interval.

end_at.description: The end of the data interval.

status.description:
The status of this backfill.

* `Cancelled` - Cancelled
* `Completed` - Completed
* `ContinuedAsNew` - Continued As New
* `Failed` - Failed
* `FailedRetryable` - Failed Retryable
* `Terminated` - Terminated
* `TimedOut` - Timedout
* `Running` - Running
* `Starting` - Starting

created_at.description: The timestamp at which this BatchExportBackfill was created.

finished_at.description: The timestamp at which this BatchExportBackfill finished, successfully or not.

last_updated_at.description: The timestamp at which this BatchExportBackfill was last updated.

batch_export.description: The BatchExport this backfill belongs to.
